definition: to adapt for use for another purpose
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: All franchised buses have already switched to ultra-low sulphur diesel.
sentences.chinese: 所有专利巴士已转用超低硫柴油。

sentences.english: Some learners think that the majority of people in the She nationality have turned to use the Han dialect.
sentences.chinese: 一些学者认为，绝大多数畲民“已经转用汉语”。

sentences.english: Denominal verb is one of the universal linguistic phenomena in English and Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 名动转用，这一有趣的语言现象在英汉语中颇为常见。

sentences.english: Clamping down too hard on pirates may also encourage people to switch to free, open-source alternatives.
sentences.chinese: 对盗版打击过严可能会驱使客户转用免费开源软件。

definition: to change over to/to switch to/to use (sth different)
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to re-use/to adapt (for another purpose)/to copy
to become a member/to join/to mix into/to participate in/to add in
to seal (with official stamp)/to stamp/fig. to ratify/to put lid on (cooking pot)/to cap/to build an extension or additional storey
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
